page.title: 13MUCKLEY CORNER NURSERY.
page.content: Muckley Corner Nursery was established in 1947, and specialises in growing ornamental and hardy nursery stock, and in particular semi-mature trees up to one ton in weight. The soil is a light sandy gravel and has been heavily enriched with organic manure, which makes it one of the highest humas soils in the district. The whole nursery is irrigated from static mains, supplied from a borehole 150 ft. deep into the Bunter sandstone - water table 67 ft. The nursery is twelve acres in extent, two acres of which were reclaimed from the disused Wyrley and Essington canal, and the dwelling house is situated in the canal bed. The business is labour intensive and supports six members of staff in conjunction with landscape and tree surgery sections.
